#labels Featured
=== Toy Example ===
See the example in directory `chord/examples/datarace_test/` of the Chord distribution. The `README` file in that directory explains how to run the datarace checker on the example. The datarace checker upon successful completion should produce files [http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.1/dataraces_by_fld.html dataraces_by_fld.html] and
[http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.1/dataraces_by_obj.html dataraces_by_obj.html]
using 1-object-sensitive alias analysis and files
[http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.2/dataraces_by_fld.html dataraces_by_fld.html] and
[http://chord.stanford.edu/examples/datarace_test/k.2/dataraces_by_obj.html dataraces_by_obj.html] using 2-object-sensitive alias analysis.

=== Case Studies ===

The experimental results from [http://berkeley.intel-research.net/mnaik/pubs/pldi06/paper.pdf our PLDI'06 paper] are available [http://berkeley.intel-research.net/mnaik/pubs/pldi06/results.html here].
